Welcome to Reyansh Bahl’s FBLA Quizzer 2021’s documentation!¶

FBLA Main¶

FBLA Main .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

main.aboutPage()[source]¶

Shows About Page with the links to this documentation.

Returns:Response object that contains about page.
main.dashboard()[source]¶

Dashboard page, redirected from login screen. This page presents options to the user to take a quiz, view reports etc. By default the selection option is to take a quiz. If user already has a quiz in progress, user can see buttons to resume existing quiz or take a new quiz.

Returns:Response object which contains dashboard html with quiz tab selected.
main.generate_report()[source]¶

Generates report when a quiz is submitted or user clicks on generate report in the reports tab.

Returns:Response object that contains a generated report in PDF file format.
main.getHelp()[source]¶

Intelligent Q&A feature: This gets called when user types a question in get help chat window. It uses Naives Bayes algorithm to classify what category the question falls in and based upon that it returns the corrresponding help related to that category. The categories and corresponding help is stored in the database. Example:

User types in: How can I customize font in reports
Category: reportgeneration
Returns:List of questions and answers corresponding to category of the question that user has asked.
main.help()[source]¶

Shows FAQs

Returns:Response object that contains FAQs page.
main.login()[source]¶

Login page, redirected from main. If the user is already logged in it redirects them straight to the dashboard, otherwise show the login page. At login screen, users first need to register (if not already registered) and then enter their email and password. Alternatively they can also use their Google Account to sign-in. They can also reset their password in case they forget. For reset, they will need to enter the email id that was used to register and on clicking reset, an email will be sent to the user where they can click on a link and reset their password.

Returns:Response object as a result of redirecting to the dashboard if user is already logged in, other response object for loginpagefirebase.html
main.logout()[source]¶

Logs out a user out of the session and removes the username from the session object and sens them back to the login screen.

Returns:Response object that contains main login screen.
main.quiz()[source]¶

Quiz page, redirected from dashboard. Here code first checks to see if the user already has a quiz in progress, if yes, it get the current state of the quiz from the database. If the user clicked on start a new quiz, this method generates a new quiz.

Returns:Response object of quiz in progress or a new quiz based upon what user selected.
main.quizInProgressExists()[source]¶

Checks if there’s a current quiz in progress for the user.

Returns:True if the user has a quiz in progress, False otherwise
main.reports()[source]¶

Show the historical quiz that the user has taken. It also presents an option to generate PDF report for each run.

Returns:Response object that contains historical reports screen.
main.settings()[source]¶

Presents users with a settings screen for the purpose of report generation. It includes various options like font size, and content to include.

Returns:Response object that contains settings screen.
main.start()[source]¶

Main route – Invoked when user visits domain When this function is invoked, the user is redirected to a login screen where users can login via email/password or Google sign-in. Users can also reset their password on login page.

Returns:Response object as a result of redirecting to the login page
main.updateCurrentQuizState()[source]¶

Updates user’s current quiz in progress as and when user changes anything. This function updates the quiz state in the database.

FBLA Quiz¶

FBLA Quiz .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class quiz.Quiz[source]¶

Contains all the functionality related to quiz. Contains dynamic backup feature: It writes data to firestore database as the backend and stores data in primary as well as backup database instance.

delete_quiz_in_progress(user)[source]¶

Deletes quiz in progress for the user email passed in as a param from both primary and backup database instances. This function gets called when user has submitted a quiz and completed. At that point there would be no quiz in progress associated with a user.

Parameters:user (string) – user email for which we want to get quiz in progress.
generate_quiz(user)[source]¶

Generates a new quiz. There are 5 types of questions and in all more than 50 questions that are stored in firestore database, which is a NoSQL document oriented database. Questions are stored in the database in a tree form with a question type being a parent node. Each question in each question type contains an id. This function uses python class random.Random to generate a random id and then uses that id to fetch a question.

Parameters:user (string) – user email for which we want to generate a new quiz. The quiz then gets associated with that user
Returns:A complete Quiz object which contains 5 different types of randomly generated questions
get_correct_answers(quizqa)[source]¶

Matches answers submitted by the user with the correct answers stored in the database.

Parameters:quizqa (dictionary) – contains answers submitted by the user.
Returns:Questions that were answered correctly by the user.
get_quiz_in_progress(user)[source]¶

Gets a quiz in progress for the user email passed in as a param from the primary database instance.

Parameters:user (string) – user email for which we want to get quiz in progress.
Returns:A complete current Quiz in progress object
update_quiz_in_progress(user, quiz_json)[source]¶

Updates quiz in progress for the user email passed in as a param to both primary and backup database instances.

Parameters:user (string) – user email for which we want to get quiz in progress.

FBLA Database Connection¶

FBLA Database Singleton .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

Singleton Connection - Only one instance exists throughout the lifecycle of the application.

Contains all the functionality related to database interaction. It connects to firestore database https://firebase.google.com/docs/firestore and implements a dynamic database backup feature by asynchronously writing to two database instance, one being primary and other one being backup.

Contains dynamic backup feature: It writes data to firestore database as the backend and stores data in primary as well as backup database instance.

getPrimaryDatabase gets a reference to the primary database. Returns reference to primary database

getBackupDatabase gets a reference to the backup database. Returns reference to backup database

update_dbref_1 updates primary database.

update_dbref_2 updates backup database.

update_both_databases asynchronously updates primary and backup databases.

FBLA User Past Reports¶

FBLA Reports .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class reports.Reports[source]¶

Contains all the functionality related to getting past quiz history for a user to be used for the purpose of report generation.

get_report_for_date(user, datetime)[source]¶

Gets all the past quiz results for a user for a particular date from the database to be used for the purpose of report generation.

Parameters:
  • user (string) – user email for which we want to get the data.
  • datetime (string.) – date time for when we want to get the data.
Returns:

A list of all the quiz results to be used for reporting purpose.
get_reports(user)[source]¶

Gets all the past quiz results for a user from the database to be used for the purpose of report generation.

Parameters:user (string) – user email for which we want to get the data
Returns:A list of all the quiz results to be used for reporting purpose.

FBLA IntelligentQA¶

FBLA IntelligentQA .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class intelligentqa.IntelligentQA[source]¶

Contains all the functionality related to quiz. Contains dynamic backup feature: It writes data to firestore database as the backend and stores data in primary as well as backup database instance.

get_frequently_asked_questions()[source]¶

Get the list of all the faqs from the database. :return: List of questions and answers.

get_help(question_json)[source]¶

Intelligent Q&A feature: This gets called when user types a question in get help chat window. It uses Naives Bayes algorithm to classify what category the question falls in and based upon that it returns the corrresponding help related to that category. The categories and corresponding help is stored in the database.

Parameters:question_json (JSON string) – question asked by the user in get help chat window
Returns:List of questions and answers corresponding to category of the question that user has asked.

FBLA NaiveBayesClassifier¶

FBLA IntelligentHelp NaiveBayesClassifier .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class naivebayesclassifier.IntelligentHelpNaiveBayesClassifier[source]¶

Classifies the question category for question asked by the user in Get Help chat window.

classify(question)[source]¶

Gets all the training data from the database and uses that to train the model using textblob.classifiers.NaiveBayesClassifier to classify the category of the question.

Parameters:question (string) – question asked by the user in get help chat window
Returns:Question category

FBLA Settings¶

FBLA Settings .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class settings.Settings[source]¶

Update user settings for the purpose of report generation. It includes various options like font size, and content to include.

get_prefs(user)[source]¶

Gets all the settings for a user from the primary database.

Parameters:user (string) – email corresponding to which the settings need to be retrieved.
Returns:Settings corresponding to the user
set_prefs(user, settings)[source]¶

Updates all the settings for a user asynchronously to both primary and backup database.

Parameters:
  • user (string) – email corresponding to which the settings need to be updated.
  • settings (dictionary) – settings object dictionary that contains the settings from UI.

FBLA Singleton¶

FBLA Singleton .. moduleauthor:: Reyansh Bahl <https://github.com/reybahl>

class singleton.Singleton(cls)[source]¶

This is a singleton file used as a decorator for Connection so as to disable creation of multiple instances of the Connection object. We do not need to create the instance again and again and this helps in saving memory and time of database connection object.

Instance()[source]¶

Creates a single instance. If there’s already an instance, it returns that instance.
